# Analysis

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(skimr)

data <- read.csv("data/all_tourist.csv")%>% 
  drop_na()

data$Date <- as.Date(paste0(data$year_month, "-01"))

data$Visitors <- as.numeric(gsub(",", "", data$Visitors))
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| title: Total Visitors

p1 <- ggplot(data, aes(x = Date, y = Visitors)) +
  geom_col(fill = "skyblue") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  scale_x_date(
    date_breaks = "4 months",
    date_labels = "%Y-%m"
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Visitors per Month on Oahu",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Visitors"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 60, hjust = 1, size = 8))

ggplotly(p1)
```

## row2

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| title: Chlorophyll vs. Turbidity

p2 <- ggplot(data, aes(x = Chlorophyll..ug.L., y = Turbidity..NTU.)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, size = 1, color = "darkgreen") +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "lightblue") +
  labs(
    title = "Chlorophyll Vs. Turbidity",
    x = "Chlorophyll (ug/L)",
    y = "Turbidity (NTU)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

ggplotly(p2)
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| title: Visitors vs. Enterococcus

data_sorted <- data[order(data$Visitors), ]

p3 <- ggplot(data_sorted, aes(x = Visitors, y = Enterococcus..mpn.100mL.)) +
  geom_line(color = "darkred", linewidth = 0.5) +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  labs(
    title = "Visitors vs. Enterococcus Levels",
    x = "Visitors",
    y = "Enterococcus (mpn/100mL)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()


ggplotly(p3)

```
